@chewedkandi Sorry for my late response I totally missed your tweet! It's strange, I have just been having a nosy at my search performance... 25% reduction in impressions/clicks for my best performing keyword, yet still 1st place position. It's good to know it's not something I've done wrong!

@lunchboxbrain Thanks! Subscriber counts are still growing, especially over at YouTube so that's the main thing. Even after a cull of a few tens-of-thousands of inactive newsletter subscribers, it's still getting bigger every day (and costing me a fortune!)

@tommythetechie Looking at the highest traffic peak in 2013, I'd need to find an additional 26,000 visitors to get back to that level, 10,778 of them from StumbleUpon... I don't think that's going to happen! ðŸ˜‚

@thelogosmith Interestingly there are no 'poor URLs' in my Google webmaster account, but plenty that 'need improvement'. Quite a few 'Google URLs' for Desktop, none for mobile. 
The whole site is due an overhaul but with so much old content it's a massive job

@thelogosmith The only time I really check Analytics is during my yearly 'birthday post', I knew it had been in a slow decline for years, however it seems search traffic has nose dived since March 2021. I had to Google what Core Vitals were so that may well be part of the cause ðŸ˜…ðŸ˜¬

@SocialMediaDale Keep an eye out for a new tutorial going out tonight!
I also send out a newsletter the day after promoting the video on Spoon Graphics, so that might be the best way to hear about new uploads if YouTube decides not to tell anybody

What a sad picture from Google Analytics! Spoon Graphics traffic is now down to April 2008 levels, incidentally, that was back when I first joined Twitter.
Traffic today is lower than on Christmas day from previous years.
Oh the good ol' days...
YouTube is still on the up though! https://t.co/DiWbs3jWEO
@kylegawley I've only just spotted this! That's great to hear. Sadly I don't think it would have quite the same effect these days!
